author: Staff Reporter
text:
Stating that road and drainage facilities were not created in their area for the past 30 years, residents of Brindavan Nagar, 4{+t}{+h}Street at Kootapalli, in Tiruchengode, threatened to boycott the Assembly elections.

They said that the area in Ward 11 was created in 1986 and residents were paying all the taxes to the municipality. However, the area lacks road facility, drainage and other basic amenities.

Residents said that due to the poor condition of the roads, school autorickshaws, vehicles carrying LPG gas and lorries cannot enter their area.

“We have to drop and pick up our children at the road end everyday,” they added.

Residents said that despite several petitions to the municipal officials, no action has been taken so far on the issues.

Hence, they have placed a hoarding stating that they are boycotting the elections.
title: Residents threaten to boycott polls over poor facilities
